title: Modified Sgarbossa's Criteria for MI in Left Bundle Branch Block
description: Diagnoses acute myocardial infarction in patients with prior left bundle branch block using ECG criteria with improved sensitivity over the original Sgarbossa criteria.

parameters.name: concordant_st_elevation
parameters.description: Concordant ST elevation ≥1 mm in leads with positive QRS complex

parameters.name: concordant_st_depression
parameters.description: Concordant ST depression ≥1 mm in leads V1, V2, or V3

parameters.name: discordant_st_elevation_ratio
parameters.description: Discordant ST elevation with ST/S ratio ≥-0.25 (modified criterion)

result.name: sgarbossa_result
result.description: Diagnosis of acute MI based on Modified Sgarbossa criteria

ranges.interpretation: Modified Sgarbossa criteria negative for acute MI in setting of LBBB.
Modified Sgarbossa criteria positive for acute MI in setting of LBBB.

references: Smith SW, Dodd KW, Henry TD, Dvorak DM, Pearce LA. Diagnosis of ST-elevation myocardial infarction in the presence of left bundle branch block with the ST-elevation to S-wave ratio in a modified Sgarbossa rule. Ann Emerg Med. 2012;60(6):766-76. doi: 10.1016/j.annemergmed.2012.07.119.

Sgarbossa EB, Pinski SL, Barbagelata A, Underwood DA, Gates KB, Topol EJ, et al. Electrocardiographic diagnosis of evolving acute myocardial infarction in the presence of left bundle-branch block. GUSTO-1 (Global Utilization of Streptokinase and Tissue Plasminogen Activator for Occluded Coronary Arteries) Investigators. N Engl J Med. 1996;334(8):481-7. doi: 10.1056/NEJM199602223340801.
Aslanger EK, Yalin K. Electrophysiologic basis, electrocardiographic features, and clinical implications of aVR sign. Ann Noninvasive Electrocardiol. 2015;20(1):12-20. doi: 10.1111/anec.12140.
formula: Modified Sgarbossa Criteria: 1) Concordant ST elevation ≥1 mm in leads with positive QRS (5 points), 2) Concordant ST depression ≥1 mm in V1-V3 (3 points), 3) Discordant ST elevation with ST/S ratio ≥-0.25 (modified from original ≥5 mm criterion). Any single criterion = positive test.
notes: Modified version improves sensitivity from 36% to 80% while maintaining 99% specificity
Key modification: replaced absolute ST elevation ≥5 mm with ST/S ratio ≥-0.25
Any single positive criterion indicates acute MI in setting of LBBB
Positive likelihood ratio of 9, negative likelihood ratio of 0.1
Should be used in conjunction with clinical presentation and cardiac biomarkers
ST/S ratio measured as ST elevation divided by depth of S wave in same lead
More sensitive than original Sgarbossa criteria for detecting acute occlusion MI
